actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to require that the mail label or other cover of any publication having periodical publication mail privileges, when mailed to a subscriber, shall bear readily intelligible information regarding the name and address of the subscriber and the expiration date of the current subscription, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Requires that the mail label or other cover of any publication having periodical publication mail privileges under the Postal Reorganization Act, when mailed to a subscriber, shall bear readily intelligible information regarding the name and address of the subscriber and the expiration date of the current subscription. Authorizes the Postal Service to make appropriate rules and regulations to carry out the purpose of the Act. (Amends 39 U.S.C. 3685 (c))

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to require that the mail label or other cover of any publication having periodical publication mail privileges, when mailed to a subscriber, shall bear readily intelligible information regarding the name and address of the subscriber and the expiration date of the current subscription, and for other purposes.
